intro.title: International Repatriation Support
intro.subtitle: Compassionate assistance when you need to bring a loved one home or arrange international transport
intro.description: Losing a loved one away from home adds additional complexity to an already difficult time. Our experienced repatriation team provides comprehensive support for families needing to transport their loved one internationally. With over 75 years of experience and a global network of trusted partners, we handle all aspects of repatriation with professionalism, dignity, and cultural sensitivity. Available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, we're here to guide you through every step of this complex process.

incoming.title: Bringing Your Loved One Home to the UK
incoming.description: When a UK resident passes away abroad, we coordinate their return home for funeral services. Whether they were on holiday, working overseas, or living abroad, we manage the entire repatriation process with care and efficiency.
services: Communication with overseas authorities and funeral directors
Arrangement of embalming and preparation abroad
Booking appropriate air or road transport
Collection from UK airport and transport to our facilities

outgoing.title: International Transport from the UK
outgoing.description: For families wishing to have funeral services in another country, we arrange respectful international transport. This includes foreign nationals returning home or UK residents with overseas burial wishes.
services: Preparation according to destination country requirements
Specialized casket or coffin for air transport
Travel arrangements for accompanying family if desired

process.title: The Repatriation Process
process.intro: We manage every detail to ensure a smooth and dignified repatriation

steps.title: Initial Contact
steps.description: Call us immediately on our 24/7 helpline. We'll gather essential information and begin coordinating with relevant authorities. Our team will guide you through immediate steps and provide emotional support.

steps.title: Documentation
steps.description: We handle all paperwork including death certificates, embalming certificates, freedom from infection certificates, and customs documents. Our team liaises with embassies, consulates, and local authorities.

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: Your loved one is prepared according to international transport regulations and receiving country requirements. This includes embalming, appropriate casket selection, and hermetic sealing if required.

steps.title: Transportation
steps.description: We book appropriate flights or ground transport, handle cargo arrangements, and coordinate with airlines. All transport is tracked and monitored throughout the journey.

steps.title: Arrival
steps.description: Upon arrival, we ensure smooth customs clearance and coordinate with local funeral directors if needed. For incoming repatriations, we collect your loved one and transport them to our facilities.

steps.title: Final Arrangements
steps.description: Once repatriation is complete, we proceed with funeral arrangements according to your wishes, whether that's a service here in Liverpool or preparation for onward travel.

timing.title: Timeframes
timing.description: Repatriation typically takes 5-10 days depending on the country and documentation requirements. Some countries may take longer due to local regulations. We keep you informed throughout the process and work to minimize delays while ensuring all legal requirements are met.

costs.title: Costs & Insurance
costs.description: Repatriation costs vary significantly based on location, transport method, and local requirements. Travel insurance often covers repatriation - we can liaise directly with insurance companies and handle claims on your behalf. We provide transparent pricing with no hidden charges.

cultural.title: Religious & Cultural Requirements
cultural.description: We respect all religious and cultural practices, coordinating with religious authorities to ensure requirements are met. This includes specific preparation methods, timing considerations for burial, and arrangement of religious ceremonies or blessings during transport.

legal.title: Legal Considerations
legal.description: Different countries have varying regulations about death abroad, including potential requirements for autopsy or inquest. We navigate these complexities on your behalf, working with legal authorities and ensuring compliance with all international regulations.

Regular updates on progress and timeline

items.question: How quickly can repatriation be arranged?
items.answer: In urgent cases, we can begin the process immediately with repatriation typically completed within 5-10 days. The exact timeframe depends on the country, local regulations, and documentation requirements. We work around the clock to minimize delays.

items.question: What if we don't have travel insurance?
items.answer: While travel insurance can cover repatriation costs, we help all families regardless of insurance status. We offer transparent pricing and flexible payment options, including installment plans. We can also advise on potential financial assistance from governments or charities.

items.question: Can family members accompany the deceased?
items.answer: Yes, we can arrange for family members to travel on the same flight where possible. We coordinate with airlines for compassionate fare rates and help with travel documentation. Some airlines allow a family member to accompany the deceased at reduced rates.

items.question: What happens if someone dies on a cruise ship?
items.answer: Cruise ship deaths require special handling. We work with cruise lines and port authorities to arrange disembarkation at the nearest suitable port, then coordinate onward repatriation. Our experience with maritime repatriations ensures smooth handling of these complex situations.

items.question: Do you handle repatriation of ashes?
items.answer: Yes, we arrange international transport of cremated remains, which is generally simpler than body repatriation. We provide appropriate urns for travel, handle documentation, and can arrange for family members to personally transport ashes or ship them separately.

items.question: What if the death occurred in suspicious circumstances?
items.answer: Deaths requiring investigation may delay repatriation while local authorities complete their procedures. We liaise with police, coroners, and consular officials to monitor progress and ensure release as soon as possible, keeping families informed throughout.
